common.ctaText: Share your context (duration, quantities, constraints). We’ll propose the right approach.

rental.title: Radiation protection equipment rental
rental.subtitle: A flexible way to equip your teams without tying up budget—backed by a full cycle of inspection, traceability and disinfection.

seo.title: Rental – Radiation protection equipment
seo.description: Aprons and equipment rental: flexibility, availability, cycle tracking, disinfection and shielding quality checks.

why.title: Why choose rental?
bullets: Cover short-term needs: projects, peak activity, replacements.
Stay agile with limited upfront investment.
Benefit from a tracked and inspected fleet with a clear re-circulation protocol.
Equipment provided according to sizes and on-site constraints.
Cycle tracking: ID, dates, duration and condition.
End of rental: return, disinfection, inspection and shielding quality checks.
Usage and storage best practices.

cons: Over long periods, purchase may be more cost-effective.
Return/processing lead time must be planned.

steps.title: 1) Needs assessment
steps.desc: Duration, quantities, sizes, and workflow constraints.

steps.title: 2) Provisioning
steps.desc: Preparation, identification, delivery or shipment.

steps.title: 3) Usage period
steps.desc: Support and recommendations (handling, storage, transport).

steps.title: 4) Return
steps.desc: Planned collection/return to secure cycle and availability.

steps.title: 5) Disinfection & checks
steps.desc: Cleaning, inspection, shielding checks, traceability, back into circulation.

quality.text: Every return triggers a compliance-ready turnaround cycle to maintain consistent safety and a premium user experience.
bullets: Specialized disinfection/cleaning protocol.
Inspection: seams, straps, folding areas, closures.
Shielding quality checks (level adapted to requirements).
Traceability: cycle history and actions performed.

faq.q: What is the minimum rental duration?
faq.a: From a few days to several months depending on the project. The quote specifies terms and duration.

faq.q: How do you ensure hygiene between rentals?
faq.a: Return = disinfection + inspection + traceability before recirculation.
Yes—adapted to your required level (defined in the quote).
Yes, especially recommended during high-demand periods.
We assess on return and recommend the best option: refurbishment, replacement, or adjustment per terms.

sales.title: Radiation protection equipment sales
sales.subtitle: Build a durable, consistent and comfortable fleet—selected for real-world use, with guidance, onboarding and best practices.

seo.title: Sales – Radiation protection equipment
seo.description: Purchase aprons and equipment: expert guidance, fleet sizing, care recommendations and optional periodic checks.

why.title: Why purchase?
bullets: Stabilize recurring needs with immediate availability.
Standardize the on-site user experience.
Optimize total cost of ownership when usage is frequent.
Selection guidance: protection level, comfort, sizes, workflow constraints.
Fleet sizing support: quantities, rotation, storage.
Care and handling best practices.
Optional: inspection / periodic check plan.

pros: Consistent fleet tailored to your teams.
Better control over organization and rotation.
cons: Internal storage and condition tracking needed.
Maintenance/check plan should be structured over time.

steps.title: 1) Scoping
steps.desc: Use cases, frequency, constraints, sizes and comfort expectations.

steps.title: 2) Recommendation
steps.desc: Equipment selection + options (rotation, storage, accessories).

steps.title: 3) Quote
steps.desc: Budget, lead times, terms and potential customization.

steps.title: 4) Delivery & onboarding
steps.desc: Delivery/shipment, verification, usage and storage guidance.

steps.title: 5) Follow-up
steps.desc: Optional periodic checks, maintenance and renewal planning.

quality.text: The goal: a coherent, comfortable and reliable fleet with clear practices that reduce wear and extend service life.
bullets: Field-driven selection—not just specs.
Best practices: folding, storage, handling, transport.
Recommended check schedule based on usage intensity.
Traceability support (IDs, rotation, history).

faq.a: Frequent usage → purchase. Short-term needs/peaks/replacements → rental. A hybrid approach is common.
Yes—often recommended: a standard base plus a few variants to cover all body types.
Yes: best practices + optional periodic checks.
Depends on quantities and sizes. The quote includes realistic lead time.

faq.q: Do you help size the fleet?
faq.a: Yes—we help calibrate quantities/rotation to avoid understock or oversizing.

quality.title: Quality checks & compliance
quality.subtitle: Secure usage, extend service life, and gain clarity: condition, traceability, recommendations and actionable decisions.

seo.title: Quality checks – Radiation protection compliance
seo.description: Inspection, shielding integrity checks, traceability and clear reporting: compliant, monitor, remove.

why.title: Why implement quality checks?
bullets: Detect early wear (folding zones, straps, seams).
Strengthen safety and day-to-day compliance.
Turn a ‘blurred’ fleet into a managed fleet (history, decisions, rotation).
Visual inspection: seams, straps, closures, high-stress areas.
Shielding integrity checks (per agreed protocol).
Status summary: compliant / monitor / remove.
Recommendations: storage, rotation, best practices.

pros: Reduces risk of using degraded equipment.

steps.title: 1) Alignment
steps.desc: Inventory, check level, frequency, operational constraints.

steps.title: 2) Collection / intake
steps.desc: Intake, ID verification and sorting.

steps.title: 3) Inspection & checks
steps.desc: Visual inspection + shielding integrity checks.

steps.title: 4) Summary
steps.desc: Per-item decision + action prioritization.

steps.title: 5) Traceability
steps.desc: History updated + recommended next check date.

quality.text: A good check must be usable: readable, traceable and actionable—with evidence aligned to your context.
bullets: Simple results: compliant / monitor / non-compliant.
Cycle history and actions.
Rotation guidance to reduce localized wear.
Option to combine with cleaning/disinfection.

faq.a: It depends on usage intensity. We set a practical schedule during alignment.
Per-item summary + recommended actions (monitor, repair, remove, replace).
Depends on volume and protocol. Rotations can minimize impact.

faq.q: Can we combine checks and cleaning?
faq.a: Yes—often the best approach: hygiene + integrity in one cycle.

faq.q: What if an item is non-compliant?
faq.a: We prioritize and recommend the safest action based on condition and usage.

cleaning.title: Specialized cleaning & refurbishment
cleaning.subtitle: A hygiene and inspection cycle that protects teams, improves comfort and extends the fleet’s service life.

seo.title: Specialized cleaning – Radiation protection equipment
seo.description: Disinfection, post-cleaning inspection, recommendations and optional full cycle with shielding checks.

why.title: Why specialized cleaning?
bullets: Ensure consistent hygiene between rotations.
Avoid cleaning methods that accelerate wear.
Detect early weaknesses before they become critical.
Cleaning/disinfection with an adapted protocol.
Post-cleaning visual inspection (seams, straps, folds).
Treatment of attention points + recommendations.
Optional: full cycle cleaning + shielding integrity checks.

cons: Rotation needed if fleet is limited.

steps.title: 1) Intake & sorting
steps.desc: Identification, initial condition check, sorting by treatment level.

steps.title: 2) Cleaning / disinfection
steps.desc: Adapted method to preserve sensitive areas and materials.

steps.title: 3) Inspection
steps.desc: Visual check: straps, seams, folds, closures.

steps.title: 4) Refurbishment
steps.desc: Minor reshaping/actions + recommendation if repair/renewal is needed.

steps.title: 5) Traceability & return
steps.desc: History updated and returned/recirculated.

quality.text: Cleaning is only valuable if it preserves integrity. Protocols are designed for hygiene without compromising performance.
bullets: Protocols adapted to materials and sensitive zones.
Storage guidance (avoid aggressive folds/compression).
Rotation guidance to reduce localized wear.
Option to combine with shielding integrity checks.

faq.q: Is every item cleaned the same way?
faq.a: No—materials and sensitive zones require an adapted protocol to avoid degradation.
Yes—after cleaning we inspect high-wear areas.
Yes—monthly/quarterly depending on usage.

faq.q: What if an issue is found?
faq.a: We flag it and recommend the right action: monitor, repair, remove or replace.
Yes—we can run a full hygiene + integrity cycle.

hero.h1: Premium radiation protection — with proof to back it up.
hero.p: Well With Waves (3W) designs and manufactures radiation protection equipment for demanding healthcare environments. From selection to maintenance, our promise is simple: comfort, durability and compliance.

company.h2: An in-house workshop at our headquarters to control quality.
company.p1: Our workshop is located at the company’s headquarters, enabling tight control over finishing, quality checks and traceability, while staying responsive for healthcare facilities.
company.p2: We take a field-driven approach: listen to care teams, recommend the right protection, and provide clear long-term support (checks, cleaning, maintenance).
company.address: 110 Rue du Smetz PePSO, 62120 Campagne-lès-Wardrecques, France

recognition.intro: Our work is supported and recognized by leading programs and juries at the intersection of innovation, care and real-world impact.
items: Fondation Mines-Télécom – IMT Numérique Fund – Laureate
French Hospital Federation (FHF) Innovation Awards – “Improving Caregiver Experience” – Laureate

team.intro: We combine product rigor with operational support: scoping, recommendations, rollout and ongoing assistance.
team.ctaDesc: We’ll get back to you quickly with a proposal tailored to your constraints and teams.

seo.title: About – Well With Waves
seo.description: Discover Well With Waves (3W): in-house workshop at HQ, quality commitments, awards (HIIT 2025, IMT Numérique Fund, FHF…), and Bpifrance Deeptech label.
